title: Output for assignment to mutable references with match statements is bad.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
let mut x = &mut 5;
x = match () { () => 5 };
```


### Current output

```Shell
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:3:22
  |
3 | x = match () { () => 5 };
  |                      ^
  |                      |
  |                      expected `&mut {integer}`, found integer
  |                      help: consider mutably borrowing here: `&mut 5`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
```


### Desired output

```Shell
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:3:22
  |
3 | x = match () { () => 5 };
  |                      ^
  |                      |
  |                      expected `&mut {integer}`, found integer
  |
help: consider dereferencing here to assign to the mutably borrowed value
  |
6 |         *x = match () { () => 5 };
  |         +

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
```


### Rationale and extra context

Output should be more synonymous with:
```rust
let mut x = &mut 5;
x = 5;
```
```Shell
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:3:5
  |
2 | let mut x = &mut 5;
  |             ------ expected due to this value
3 | x = 5;
  |     ^ expected `&mut {integer}`, found integer
  |
help: consider dereferencing here to assign to the mutably borrowed value
  |
3 | *x = 5;
  | +

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
```

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
